Moving to JDT for comments. Is the java editor image being disposed somewhere? 
If not, maybe this is a problem with SWT?

Kai, can you please comment. 

IMO we don't dispose the image. If we would then an error would show up under 
Windows as well. But it doesn't

I'm not Kai, but I can confirm that we don't dispose foreign images. We remember
the image we create and use to set the title image and later dispose the
remembered image.

The image reported as disposed is the one set in CTabItem.setImage.  The 
application must not dispose of the image passed into CTabItem.  If you wish 
to dispose of the image, you must first call CTabItem.setImage(null) or 
CTabItem.dispose().

This is not an SWT bug.

Re routing back to UI to determine who is disposing of the image.  I thought 
you guys always used an image manager and that only the image manage rwas 
supposed to dispose of the image.

Note: I am running I200307160800 on GTK RedHat 9 and I have never seen this 
error.  Adam, do you have any other plugins installed?  Does it happen with 
only Java files open?
*** Bug 40379 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Philippe is reporting this on Win2K.

the only addiotional plugin i use is pde.junit.
i wasn't able to reproduce it today

I tried to reproduce it under WindowsXP using I20030717 + the latest JDT code 
and I wasn't to do so.
Tod, can you please determine if this is still an issue?
I believe this error is fixed. Please reopen if not.
